pull.title: Addrman offline attempts
pull.body:
If a node is offline failed outbound connection attempts will crank up
the addrman counter and effectively blow away our state.

This change reduces the problem by only counting attempts made while
the node believes it has outbound connections to at least two
netgroups.

Connect and addnode connections are also not counted, as there is no
reason to unequally penalize them for their more frequent
connections -- though there should be no real effect from this
unless their addnode configureation is later removed.

Wasteful repeated connection attempts while only a few connections are
up are avoided via nLastTry.

This is still somewhat incomplete protection because our outbound
peers could be down but not timed out or might all be on 'local'
networks (although the requirement for multiple netgroups helps).

( reopen of #6030 )

issue.title: Avoid counting failed connect attempts when probably offline.
issue.body:
If a node is offline failed outbound connection attempts will crank up
 the addrman counter and effectively blow away our state.

This change reduces the problem by only counting attempts made while
 the node believes it has outbound connections to at least two
 netgroups.

Connect and addnode connections are also not counted, as there is no
 reason to unequally penalize them for their more frequent
 connections -- though there should be no real effect from this
 unless their addnode configureation is later removed.

Wasteful repeated connection attempts while only a few connections are
 up are avoided via nLastTry.

This is still somewhat incomplete protection because our outbound
 peers could be down but not timed out or might all be on 'local'
 networks (although the requirement for multiple netgroups helps).

events.body: This should probably be checking for connections to at least two netgroups outside of RFC1918 IP space, but this is certainly an improvement.

@pstratem checking connections is better than no check at all.  This PR is from April 2015, so I'm not inclined to expand the scope any further right now. If this is accepted I'll happily open a follow on PR to make it stronger.
Can one of the admins verify this patch?

events.message:
Avoid counting failed connect attempts when probably offline.

If a node is offline failed outbound connection attempts will crank up
 the addrman counter and effectively blow away our state.

This change reduces the problem by only counting attempts made while
 the node believes it has outbound connections to at least two
 netgroups.

Connect and addnode connections are also not counted, as there is no
 reason to unequally penalize them for their more frequent
 connections -- though there should be no real effect from this
 unless their addnode configureation is later removed.

Wasteful repeated connection attempts while only a few connections are
 up are avoided via nLastTry.

This is still somewhat incomplete protection because our outbound
 peers could be down but not timed out or might all be on 'local'
 networks (although the requirement for multiple netgroups helps).

Do not increment nAttempts by more than one for every Good connection.

This slows the increase of the nAttempts in addrman while partitioned,
 even if the node hasn't yet noticed the partitioning.

events.body: Running a public node with #7960 #8007 #8065 #8080 #8082 #8084 #8086 for testing.
This should be easy to test manually: add a debug log entry above the info.nAttempts increment in CAddrMan::Attempt_(), and see how often it triggers with network connected and disconnected.

issue.title: [port] PR #8065 Addrman offline attempts
issue.body:
This is a port of Core #8065. 

Form original commit message:

> If a node is offline failed outbound connection attempts will crank up
the addrman counter and effectively blow away our state.

this is a prerequisite to port and addrman bug fix (#7696) and the feeler connections implementation (#8282) to defend against from the attack to bitcoin net described in "Eclipse Attacks on Bitcoin’s Peer-to-Peer Network", Ethan Heilman, Alison Kendler, Aviv Zohar, Sharon Goldberg. ePrint Archive Report
2015/263. March 2015.

`91b33b0` Adapt OpenNetworkConnection to the new semantic (Andrea Suisani)
`77a5dbc` Merge #8065: Addrman offline attempts (Wladimir J. van der Laan)

issue.title: [port] PR #8282 net: Feeler connections to increase online addrs in the tried table
issue.body:
This is a port of core #8282 and subsequent fixes (#8944, #9008). This also port a fix de-serialization bug where AddrMan is corrupted after exception (#7696)

This PR implements countermeasures 3 (feeler connections) suggested in our paper: "Eclipse Attacks on Bitcoin’s Peer-to-Peer Network".

It contains also #449, once it get merged it will need to be rebased.  

This is the list of commits:

`8f88aa0` net: Set feelers to disconnect at the end of the version message (Cory Fields)
`8708ac1` Merge #9008: [net] Remove assert(nMaxInbound > 0) (Wladimir J. van der Laan)
`73b2a39` Merge #8944: Remove bogus assert on number of oubound connections. (Wladimir J. van der Laan)
`40f8ffc` Merge #8282: net: Feeler connections to increase online addrs in the tried table. (Wladimir J. van der Laan)
`ac53931` Merge #7696: Fix de-serialization bug where AddrMan is left corrupted (Pieter Wuille)
`45bef70` Adapt OpenNetworkConnection to the new semantic (Andrea Suisani)
`acc6b17` Merge #8065: Addrman offline attempts (Wladimir J. van der Laan)

issue.title: Networking improvements
issue.body:
Networking, peer management, and privacy cherry-picks.

addrman catch-up
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7125 Replace global trickle node with random delays
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6412 Test whether created sockets are select()able
  https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7696 Fix de-serialization bug where AddrMan is left corrupted
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8065 Addrman offline attempts
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8282 Feeler connections to increase online addrs in the tried table
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8944 Remove bogus assert on number of oubound connections
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/d74e352e0136bb746c2975f9a4092f23b9d8899c Set feelers to disconnect at the end of the version message
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8069 Remove non-determinism which is breaking net_tests
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7932 CAddrMan::Deserialize handle corrupt serializations better

issue.title: [Net] Addrman offline attempts
issue.body:
Backport of https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8065

> If a node is offline failed outbound connection attempts will crank up
> the addrman counter and effectively blow away our state.
> 
> This change reduces the problem by only counting attempts made while
> the node believes it has outbound connections to at least two
> netgroups.
> 
> Connect and addnode connections are also not counted, as there is no
> reason to unequally penalize them for their more frequent
> connections -- though there should be no real effect from this
> unless their addnode configureation is later removed.
> 
> Wasteful repeated connection attempts while only a few connections are
> up are avoided via nLastTry.
> 
> This is still somewhat incomplete protection because our outbound
> peers could be down but not timed out or might all be on 'local'
> networks (although the requirement for multiple netgroups helps).

Note: A future PR will focus on refactoring the layer 2 (masternode) methods to stop using `ConnectNode()` directly

issue.title: Verify that expected services are available from peer nodes & disconnect otherwise.
issue.body:
Backport of bitcoin/bitcoin#7749

Currently includes #2534, #4996, and #5003 this should be rebased once those merge.

Includes:
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7181
- bitcoin/bitcoin#8049
- bitcoin/bitcoin#8065
- bitcoin/bitcoin#8083

Assembled from the following (commits listed in stack order):
- pick bitcoin/bitcoin@ecd7fd37c8
- pick bitcoin/bitcoin@ee06e04369
  - requires bitcoin/bitcoin#8049
    - pick bitcoin/bitcoin@1ab1dc3140
    - pick bitcoin/bitcoin@581ddff05c
      - requires #4996; merged
- pick bitcoin/bitcoin@15bf863219
  - conflict in addrman_tests.cpp -> resolve in favor of zcash/zcash@7fa7225509
  - conflicts in src/net.cpp 
    - requires bitcoin/bitcoin#8065
      - pick bitcoin/bitcoin@6182d10503
      - pick bitcoin/bitcoin@c769c4af1
        - requires #5003; merged
    - requires bitcoin/bitcoin#8083
      - pick bitcoin/bitcoin@2d83013dc5
    - requires bitcoin/bitcoin#7181
      - pick bitcoin/bitcoin@9bbe71b641
- pick bitcoin/bitcoin@5e7ab16d29
- pick bitcoin/bitcoin@fc83f18153
- pick bitcoin/bitcoin@3764dec36c
